Hedger Pressure Indicator

CoT hedger pressure: supply expansion & shortage stress.

As of 2025-12-23

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • The Hedger Pressure signal, as of 2025-12-23, indicates a prevailing "High Shortage / Stress" regime, alongside "Normal" supply expansion pressure (1). This divergence suggests tightening physical market conditions despite typical supply expansion sentiment.
  • Conviction Band: High | Interpretation Confidence: High Confidence | Internal Conflict Flag: No.

Key Dynamics:

  • The `Hedger_ShortagePressure_z` registered 1.66 (1), well above the 1.0 threshold for "High Shortage / Stress" (1). This is driven by 93 markets showing deep long hedger positioning, representing a `hedger_deep_long_share` of 0.26 (1).
  • Conversely, `Hedger_SupplyPressure_z` was -0.37 (1), indicating "Normal" supply conditions, with 67 markets showing deep short positioning (1).
  • Conditional Invalidation: The signal would reverse if `Hedger_ShortagePressure_z` falls below 0.5, shifting from "High Shortage / Stress" to "Normal" (1).

Scenario Balance:

  • Base Case dominant: Continued physical market tightness and potential upward pressure on prices due to persistent hedger long positioning (1).
  • Upside secondary: An intensification of physical shortage pressure, potentially driven by further increases in hedger deep long share or an acceleration of the `Hedger_ShortagePressure_z`.
  • Downside residual: An easing of shortage conditions, marked by `Hedger_ShortagePressure_z` declining below 0.5.

Time Horizon & Aggregation:

  • Time Horizon: Cyclical (months) | This signal reflects sentiment and inventory stress in physical markets, which can build and persist over several months (1).
  • Aggregation Weight Hint: High | The clear and robust "High Shortage / Stress" regime provides strong directional insight into fundamental supply/demand dynamics (1).

Macro Relevance:

  • Macro dimension informed: Pricing, Slack.
  • Cycle position: Mid-cycle, as commodity supply/demand dynamics often influence broader inflation and economic activity.
  • Typical interaction with other macro signals: This signal often correlates with commodity price signals (e.g., Copper (2), Crude Oil (3)) and can precede shifts in inflation term-structure expectations (4) or overall economic cycles (5).

Data & References:

  • df_cot_signals, Hedger_zscore, Hedger_Net_%OI, Market_and_Exchange_Names (latest observation 2025-12-23) (1).
  • The `hedger_deep_long_share` and its robust z-score, `Hedger_ShortagePressure_z` are most influential for the current state (1).
  • Additional public datasets: Sector-specific inventory levels, commodity forward curves.
